title: Stafford wins first MVP, says he'll return in '26
content: Rams QB Matthew Stafford edged Drake Maye in the closest MVP vote since 2003, then closed his acceptance speech by saying he'll return to play next season.

title: Brees, Fitzgerald make Hall of Fame in first year
content: The Pro Football Hall of Fame will welcome five into its 2026 class, including Drew Brees and Larry Fitzgerald -- who were in their first year of eligibility -- as well as Adam Vinatieri, Luke Kuechly and Roger Craig.

title: Garrett named DPOY; JSN wins offensive honors
content: Myles Garrett's record-breaking season earned him a unanimous selection as Defensive Player of the Year, while Jaxon Smith-Njigba narrowly won Offensive Player of the Year at Thursday's NFL Honors ceremony.

title: Doncic limps off in 1st half; MRI set on hamstring
content: Lakers star Luka Doncic limped off the court in the second quarter Thursday night against the Sixers and will undergo an MRI on his left hamstring Friday.

title: Jets DT Phillips: Glenn inherited 'cancerous' group
content: Jets DT Harrison Phillips said it has been difficult for the team to get over the franchise's losing culture, saying first-year coach Aaron Glenn inherited a "cancerous" group.

title: Dubs confident oft-injured Porzingis ready to play
content: The Warriors are unsure when the newly acquired Kristaps Porzingis will make his debut but did say the anticipation is the oft-injured big man would be back on the court soon.

title: Doc: Clase accused of rigged pitches in 48 games
content: Cleveland Guardians pitcher Emmanuel Clase is accused of throwing suspect pitches to benefit bettors in at least 48 games over two years, significantly more than was initially revealed by prosecutors, according to a court document.

title: Trump signs law that withholds U.S. WADA dues
content: A provision for the U.S. to withhold its annual dues to WADA is now law until the organization takes steps to address the country's accusations that it's beholden to Chinese influence.

title: ðŸ¥‡ Faces of the Games: U.S. Olympians to watch
content: On Friday, the 2026 Milan Cortina Olympics will kick off. From Lindsey Vonn to Amber Glenn, here are the athletes you'll want to know.

title: Making sense of NBA trade deadline week: We picked the real winners and losers
content: After a wild week of superstar movement, Zach Kram unveils his winners and losers of the NBA trade deadline.

title: Barnwellâ€™s annual Super Bowl opus: We size up every facet of Seahawks-Patriots and pick the winner
content: Can Drake Maye hit enough big plays? Which Sam Darnold will show up? And will defense define this Super Bowl matchup? Let's go deep on Seahawks-Patriots.

title: How Laila Edwards carved her own path as USA Hockey's first Black player
content: Laila Edwards, a standout at Wisconsin, is ready for her Olympic debut as USA Hockey's first Black player.

title: Who you calling old? At the 2026 Olympics, age is just a number
content: Lindsey Vonn, Nick Goepper, Gus Kenworthy and Maddy Schaffrick are in their golden years at the 2026 Olympics. Just don't call them old.

title: No Spanish? No problem: Bad Bunny promises a party at halftime
content: Ahead of Sunday's halftime show, Bad Bunny reassured fans that his performance is meant to be felt, not translated.

title: Super Bowl LX: Seahawks-Patriots marks latest rematch in big game
content: This year marks the 10th different repeat Super Bowl matchup and the fourth in which the Patriots are involved.

title: Wetzel: Standing on the brink of anything-goes NCAA eligibility
content: By not controlling who is eligible, the NCAA is losing the ability to function as an organizing athletic body.

title: NHL Awards Watch: Kucherov gaining on MacKinnon for MVP?
content: We polled PHWA voters to find out who's ahead in the major races as some new names have entered the conversation for the Hart and Vezina.

title: Olney and Passan's MLB offseason lessons -- and what they mean for baseball's future
content: From more outrage over MLB's top spenders to what to make of deals that never happened, here's what we learned this winter.

title: High school stories of 11 Super Bowl stars -- and two coaches
content: Find out what Sam Darnold, Drake Maye, Cooper Kupp, TreVeyon Henderson and others were like before the NFL.

title: Sixty bets for Super Bowl LX
content: We navigated the thousands of bets being offered for Super Bowl LX and narrowed it down to our 60 favorite from 10 different categories.

title: Super Bowl LX betting buzz: Bettor places $1,000 MVP wagers on Super Bowl kickers
content: Multiple sportsbooks have reported taking MVP wagers on long shots, including a variety of Seahawks defenders.

title: Wrexham have Premier League in sight, just five years after Reynolds and Mac takeover
content: Feb. 9 marks five years since Ryan Reynolds and Rob Mac completed their Wrexham takeover and already, they're on track for promotion to the Premier League.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Where all 30 teams stack up ahead of trade deadline
content: Which players are under the most pressure and where all 30 teams rank a day before the Thursday trade deadline.

title: Road to $1M paydays: How WNBA salaries evolved with each CBA
content: For the first time, a $1 million base salary is expected in the new WNBA CBA, and the cap could see a 230% increase.

title: 12 teams that improved their 2026 CFP chances with their roster moves
content: With signing day closing many team's personnel moves, we look at the teams ready to make long postseason runs.

title: From AD and Harden to Zubac and Vucevic: Fantasy reaction to the latest NBA trades
content: Andre Snellings and Eric Moody provide fantasy reactions as trades go down leading up to Thursday's NBA trade deadline.

title: Men's boxing pound-for-pound rankings: Stevenson moves up, shakes up the top 10
content: Shakur Stevenson's victory over Teofimo Lopez Jr. vaulted him up the list, but just how high did he climb? Here are the latest ESPN pound-for-pound rankings.

title: Delhi Biker Told Twin He'll Be Home In 10 Minutes. Then A 7-Hour Search
content: Kamal spoke to his twin brother, Karan, around midnight and said he would reach home within minutes. But when he didn't come for 30 minutes, the family grew suspicious and began the search.

title: Why Jamaat-e-Islami Remains Bangladesh's Most Controversial Party
content: Bangladesh is preparing for a historic general election on February 12, and Jamaat-e-Islami (JI), a hardline Islamist party, is back in the spotlight. Once banned and politically weak, the party is now emerging as a strong contender.

title: 'Cyber-Terrorism Laws Weaponised': UN Experts Slam Pakistan Over Jailing of Lawyers
content: United Nations human rights experts have sounded the alarm over what they describe as a deeply troubling assault on the rule of law in Pakistan.

title: "Court Can't Compel A Woman": Top Court Allows Ending Teen's 30-Week Pregnancy
content: Reiterating that a woman's reproductive autonomy trumps the right of an unborn child, the Supreme Court on Friday allowed the termination of a 30-week pregnancy.

title: Parliament Budget Session Day 5 Live Updates: Lok Sabha Adjourned Till Monday Amid Opposition Protests
content: Parliament Budget Session Day 5 Live Updates: The Lok Sabha will resume with Question Hour first on its agenda, a day after protests and sloganeering led to repeated adjournments of the House.

title: Video: Bengaluru Bike Rider Attacks Car, Makes Obscene Gestures
content: A bike rider in Bengaluru stopped a car, made obscene gestures and attacked the vehicle on Friday, bringing another case of road rage to light in the city.

title: Rs 61 Lakh Cash, 2.5 kg Gold Found In Raids On Retired Andhra Engineer
content: In a major anti-corruption operation, the Andhra Pradesh Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) has uncovered assets worth more than Rs 30 crore allegedly amassed by retired Panchayat Raj Superintending Engineer Kallepalli Srinivasa Rao.

title: "Unethical, Unconstitutional": Political Row Erupts Over 'Ghooskhor Pandat'
content: Netflix's upcoming film Ghooskhor Pandat, directed by Neeraj Pandey and starring Manoj Bajpayee, has sparked a major political and social controversy ever since its teaser was released on Tuesday.

title: Delhi Biker Dies In Uncovered Civic Body Pit, Then Family's Night-Long Search
content: A biker died after he fell into a pit in Delhi's Janakpuri today. In photos that are viral on social media, the man's body can be seen lying next to his Apache RTR 200 bike at the bottom of the pit. The man was wearing a helmet.

title: Explained: 13.3 Km Long Missing Link Project On Mumbai-Pune Expressway
content: The Missing Link is an over Rs 6,600 crore infrastructure project aimed at bypassing the Khopoli-Khandala ghat stretch, one of the most congested and accident-prone parts of the Mumbai-Pune Expressway.

title: 'Should Go to Heaven': Trump Praises Own Record On Religious Issues
content: US President Donald Trump believes he has a chance of going to heaven, in contrast with his past remarks where he appeared unsure about the same.

title: Explained: What Is Claude Opus 4.6, Anthropic's New AI Model
content: Anthropic has launched Claude Opus 4.6, its most advanced artificial intelligence model. The company says the model is better at coding, can handle longer and more complex tasks, and produces more professional work outputs.

title: 89 Indians On US' 'Worst Of The Worst' Criminal List Amid Trump's Immigration Crackdown
content: As many as 89 people of Indian origin are on the US list of "Worst of the Worst" criminals. The database, launched by the United States Department of Homeland Security (DHS), lists around 25,000 "criminal illegal aliens."

title: Video: Malayalam Actor Speeds Away After Biker Falls In Crash With His Car
content: Senior Malayalam actor Maniyanpilla Raju has been accused of involvement in a hit-and-run incident that left two young men injured in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, late last night.

title: Opinion: Opinion | There Are Two Big Problems Trump May Run Into If He Actually Attacks Iran
content: It is impossible to predict with certainty if the US will take the military option, but if they do, it will be from a position of discomfort.

title: 'Missing Girls Hype Due To Paid Promotion': Delhi Police Warns Of Action
content: The panic over a surge in missing persons in Delhi was a result of promotional tactics, police have said, debunking claims that 807 people had gone missing in January's first 15 days.

title: RBI Keeps Repo Rate Unchanged At 5.25% In First Policy Decision After Budget
content: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has kept its key lending rate, known as the repo rate, unchanged at 5.25% in the first monetary policy decision after Union Budget 2026.

title: "Leave Iran Now": US' Urgent Warning To Americans Amid Trump's Attack Threat
content: Amid rising tension between Washington and Tehran, the United States has warned its citizens in Iran to "immediately" leave the West Asian country.

title: On Camera, Woman Groped, Dragged, Assaulted For 15 Minutes In Maharashtra
content: A woman was groped, dragged, harassed, and physically assaulted in Maharashtra's Chhatrapati Sambhaji Nagar in the early hours of January 31. The woman tried to free herself from the man's grip, but he kept pulling her back.

title: Black hoodie, scooter and Thar: CCTV captures fatal shooting of AAP leader outside gurdwara
content: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) functionary Lucky Oberoi was fatally shot outside a Jalandhar gurdwara by a masked assailant. CCTV footage captured the masked man firing multiple shots at close range before fleeing on a scooter with an accomplice. Oberoi, a financier and property dealer, succumbed to his injuries at a hospital.

title: 'Readiness to defend against any adventurism': Ahead of US talks, Iran issues big warning
content: Iran's Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi warned of defending against US "adventurism" ahead of Oman-mediated talks. He emphasized diplomacy for national interests, stating Iran is ready to protect its sovereignty. The discussions aim to address Tehran's nuclear program, with both nations holding differing views on past events and future commitments.

title: 'Paid promotion': Delhi Police reacts to 'hype around surge in missing girls'
content: Delhi Police refuted claims of a surge in missing girls and children, attributing the narrative to paid promotions and warning of legal action. Official data indicates a stable trend with a marginal decline in missing-person cases over the past decade, highlighting a high recovery rate.

title: 'No one should ...': Apple CEO makes a promise to staff on immigration law
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook expressed deep distress over the US immigration approach, vowing to lobby lawmakers for reform and offering strong support to DACA workers. He also highlighted AI as a profound opportunity and discussed Apple's succession planning and upcoming 50th-anniversary celebration.

title: â€˜Played through flu & feverâ€™: Coach reveals after Mandhana leads RCB to WPL glory
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru clinched their second WPL title with a stunning chase, powered by captain Smriti Mandhana's incredible 87.  Despite battling a severe flu and high fever, Mandhana's match-winning knock, alongside Georgia Voll's 79, guided RCB to a record-breaking 204-run victory over Delhi Capitals. Coach Malolan Rangarajan lauded her exceptional performance and leadership.

title: Google CEO thinks bloodbath in markets in reaction to Anthropic is overblown
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang dismiss market panic over AI plugins, calling it overblown. Despite a significant selloff in software stocks triggered by Anthropic's legal AI tools, they argue AI will enhance, not replace, existing software, enabling greater productivity and innovation.

title: After Noida techie tragedy, Delhi biker dies falling into pit; family runs pillar to post overnight
content: A 25-year-old man died in Janakpuri, Delhi, after his motorcycle plunged into an open construction pit. His family faced a night of searching multiple police stations before being informed of his death. The accident occurred on Joginder Singh Marg. The area reportedly lacked safety measures. An investigation is underway to determine responsibility for the fatal incident.

title: Raghuvanshi honeymoon murder rerun? How bride plotted husbandâ€™s ambush with lover during stroll
content: A routine evening walk turned fatal for Ashish Kumar in Rajasthan, allegedly orchestrated by his wife, Anjali, and her long-time boyfriend. Police claim Anjali signaled her boyfriend and his friends to ambush Ashish, staging it as a robbery. Investigators uncovered a six-year relationship and a plot hatched just weeks prior, leading to the arrests of all four accused.

title: T20 World Cup: Shivam Dubeâ€”a gladiator with a bat in his hands
content: Shivam Dubeâ€™s role is probably Indiaâ€™s first true specialist in T20 cricket, someone whose primary job is to dismantle spinners in the middle overs. So far, he has performed that role to perfection, and not just against spin; he is now pulling fast bowlers into the stands as well. He has worked tirelessly on his bowling and has also fixed his issues against short-pitched deliveries.

title: Elon Musk responds to reports of SpaceX launching a Starlink phone
content: Elon Musk has clarified that SpaceX is not developing a Starlink phone, refuting recent reports. Musk previously expressed strong reluctance to create a phone, deeming it a massive undertaking. This statement comes as Starlink continues its rapid growth as a key revenue driver for SpaceX.

title: Rajpal Yadav surrenders at Tihar Jail after Delhi High Court denies relief
content: Bollywood actor Rajpal Naurang Yadav on Thursday surrendered before the Tihar Jail authorities after the Delhi High Court refused to extend the deadline granted to him in connection with his conviction in multiple cheque dishonour cases.

title: Repo rate stays at 5.25%: GDP and inflation outlook explained â€“ what it means for your EMIs
content: What does the RBI monetary policy say on Indiaâ€™s GDP growth and inflation outlook? What does the decision to keep repo rate at 5.25% mean for your loan EMIs, fixed deposit and mutual fund investments? We take a look:

title: Setback for actor Vijay: Madras HC bins TVK chief's plea challenging Rs 1.5cr penalty by I-T dept
content: Madras High Court has dismissed actor Vijay's plea challenging a Rs 1.5 crore penalty imposed by the income tax department. The department claimed Vijay failed to disclose Rs 15 crore income from the movie 'Puli' during the 2015-16 assessment period. The court concurred with the department's submissions, upholding the penalty.

title: NFL Honors Awards 2026: List of winners as Patriots and Rams lead the spotlight
content: The NFL Honors Awards 2026 celebrated the leagueâ€™s top performers ahead of Super Bowl LX. Matthew Stafford won MVP after a career-best season, while Myles Garrett claimed Defensive Player of the Year with a record-breaking sack total. Christian McCaffrey earned Comeback Player honors, Mike Vrabel was named Coach of the Year, and standout rookies also took center stage.

title: Pariksha Pe Charcha: PM Modi urges students to focus on skillsâ€”top quotes
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi engaged with students nationwide in the 9th Pariksha Pe Charcha, offering guidance on exams, personal growth, and nation-building. He emphasized the importance of dreams, action, balance in life, and the equal significance of life and professional skills, urging students to avoid treating education as a burden and focus on holistic development.

title: Big jolt for Australia! Pace spearhead ruled out of T20 World Cup
content: Australia's T20 World Cup campaign faces a significant blow as veteran pacer Josh Hazlewood is ruled out due to a hamstring injury. This marks the first World Cup since 2011 without the famed "Big Three" quicks. Captain Mitch Marsh, despite depleted pace stocks, expresses confidence in the squad's depth and hints at a spin-focused approach for the upcoming tournament.

title: Can â€˜SKYâ€™ emulate Hitman â€” will India miss Rohit Sharmaâ€™s calm at the T20 World Cup?
content: Rohit Sharma, T20 World Cup ambassador and 2024 champion captain, will be honored before India's opener. Former coach Paras Mhambrey highlights Rohit's invaluable leadership, especially his 'bowler's captain' approach and calm demeanor, crucial for the team's success. The data-driven think-tank under Rohit and Dravid is also noted.

title: Ghaziabad suicides: Dad deleted girlsâ€™ YouTube channel over 'Korea obsession' â€” what autopsy reveals
content: Three sisters, aged 16, 14, and 12, tragically died by suicide in Ghaziabad after their father objected to their deep fascination with Korean culture and K-dramas. Their YouTube channel, dedicated to this passion, was deleted shortly before their deaths. The girls, who had become increasingly isolated, reportedly lived in a fantasy world, dreaming of visiting Korea.

title: Taylor Swift announces â€˜Opaliteâ€™ music video
content: Excitement is in the air as Taylor Swift gears up to unveil her stunning music video for 'Opalite,' a highlight from her recent album 'The Life of a Showgirl.' Tune in on February 6th at 6:30 PM IST to catch the exclusive premiere on Spotify Premium and Apple Music, before it hits YouTube two days later.

title: Tamil Nadu elections: How BJP plans to do a Bihar in state and will it be enough?
content: The BJP is attempting to replicate its Bihar electoral strategy in Tamil Nadu by consolidating opposition forces and forming a broad social alliance across major caste segments. Aiming to counter the DMK, the party is forging alliances with former partners and breakaway factions, including the AIADMK and PMK, to build a wider NDA for the upcoming assembly elections.

title: Naravane memoir row: Kiren Rijiju cites book to target Nehru, counter Rahul Gandhi
content: A political row erupted in Parliament over Rahul Gandhi quoting former Army Chief General MM Naravane's memoir. Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju defended the government's decision to keep the Henderson Brooks-Bhagat report on the 1962 war classified. He stated the report is a sensitive defence document and should not be used for political purposes.

title: â€˜She has gone through a lotâ€™: Patil dedicates RCBâ€™s WPL triumph to Smriti Mandhana
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru secured their second Women's Premier League championship. They defeated Delhi Capitals in a thrilling final on Thursday. Captain Smriti Mandhana played a pivotal role with a remarkable innings. This victory marks a significant achievement for the team. The win also holds personal significance for the captain and the team.

title: Punjab: AAP leader Lucky Oberoi shot dead outside gurdwara
content: Aam Aadmi Party functionary Lucky Oberoi was shot dead outside a gurdwara in Jalandhar's Model Town area early Friday morning. The attack occurred while Oberoi was inside his Thar vehicle, with initial reports indicating four to five rounds were fired. The incident is currently under investigation.

title: Vascular surgeon recommends simple morning routine to lower blood pressure
content: A vascular surgeon highlights the critical role of the first 30 minutes after waking in combating India's silent cardiovascular epidemic. Simple morning habits like mindful breathing, hydration, gentle movement, a short walk, and a balanced breakfast can significantly support vascular health and reduce long-term heart disease risk, especially for those over 35.

title: â€˜Youâ€™ll save a fortuneâ€™: What is TrumpRx? All about Trumpâ€™s online drugstore plan
content: US President Trump's new TrumpRx website is rolling out, aiming to slash prescription drug costs by getting them straight from manufacturers.  They're promising big savings on popular meds like weight-loss and fertility treatments, using a 'most favoured nation' pricing strategy. This is all about making healthcare more affordable for Americans, especially with midterms on the horizon.

title: YouTube reveals $60bn revenue in 2025, surpassing Netflix for the first time
content: YouTube has officially revealed its impressive financial performance, generating over $60 billion in revenue for 2025 through advertising and paid subscriptions. This significant figure surpasses Netflix and highlights YouTube's evolution into a dominant global media powerhouse. The platform's growth is fueled by increasing viewer engagement and a strong performance from its subscription services.

title: Sub-zero shock in Manali: Mumbai woman dies after sudden shivering during Solang Valley visit
content: A Mumbai tourist tragically died from suspected cold exposure in Manali's freezing Solang Valley. Meanwhile, Kullu witnessed a rare winter landslide, and avalanches pose a threat in higher altitudes.  A minor earthquake also rattled Kinnaur.  These events highlight the severe weather conditions gripping Himachal Pradesh.

title: 5 of Indiaâ€™s fastest-growing real estate corridors outside metro cities
content: Non-metro Indian cities are emerging as the next frontier in real estate, driven by infrastructure development, affordability, and changing lifestyle preferences of young homebuyers. Cities like Nagpur, Lucknow, Jaipur, Surat, and Ahmedabad are experiencing significant growth, attracting investment and contributing to balanced regional development.

title: â€˜Wonâ€™t play Indiaâ€™: Pak PM backs B'desh stance; Surya says, â€˜Our flight is bookedâ€™
content: Pakistan's PM Shehbaz Sharif declared their T20 WC boycott against India as 'appropriate', supporting Bangladesh. India's captain stated they haven't refused to play, attributing the decision to Pakistan. Both captains await government and ICC decisions, with India ready to play in Colombo as scheduled. The ICC expressed concern over selective participation.

title: US warns its citizens to â€˜leave Iran nowâ€™; is a strike imminent?
content: Amidst escalating US-Iran tensions, Washington has urged its citizens to depart Iran immediately. President Trump issued a stern warning to Iran's supreme leader, highlighting a US naval "armada" deployment. Planned talks in Oman aim to address Tehran's nuclear program and regional issues, with both nations emphasising diplomacy while maintaining military readiness.

title: Rupee in green: Currency rises 9 paise to 90.25 against US dollar
content: The Indian Rupee saw a slight gain against the US dollar, buoyed by trade deal optimism but tempered by caution ahead of the RBI's monetary policy.  Stock markets mirrored this hesitant mood, opening lower as investors await the central bank's decision.  Corporate dollar demand and domestic equity weakness also influenced currency movements.

title: Impact of US sanctions: India import of Russian crude in Dec lowest since Feb 2025
content: The US had announced sanctions on the two companies on Oct 22 and set Nov 21 as the deadline for all dealings with them to be wound down. As per data shared by the ministry of commerce and industry, Dec supplies of Russian oil were nearly 27% lower compared with imports worth $3.7 billion a month earlier in Nov 2025, and over 15% lower than the $3.2 billion imported during the corresponding month in 2024.

title: 'No cash, take my radish': Farmer protests 'bribe' demand over pending farm road in Karnataka
content: A farmer's unique protest in Bengaluru, using radishes to highlight alleged bribery demands by revenue officials, has brought attention to stalled civic work. Prasanna Kumar staged his demonstration after a Lokayukta order for a farm approach road remained unfulfilled for months. He claims officials sought money, offering his produce as an alternative to payment.

title: â€˜Ee sala cup namduâ€™: Mandhana hails â€˜3 titles in 3 yearsâ€™ as RCBâ€™s golden run continues
content: Smriti Mandhana led Royal Challengers Bengaluru to their second WPL title, defeating Delhi Capitals by six wickets.  Mandhana praised the team's belief and the support staff's clarity, dedicating the win to the passionate RCB fanbase.  Georgia Voll's aggressive batting and Lauren Bell's bowling were crucial in the successful chase of 204.

title: $2 trillion wiped off crypto markets! Bitcoin down 46% since October 2025
content: Bitcoin has experienced significant losses, dropping over 20% since early 2026 and losing nearly half its value since its October peak. This decline, exacerbated by concerns over Federal Reserve policy and tech sector weakness, has impacted companies holding digital assets and erased gains since Trump's election.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in red ahead of RBI meet; BSE Sensex down 100 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red ahead of the RBI monetary policy. While Nifty50 opened below 25,600, BSE Sensex was down over 100 points.

title: IndiGoâ€™s December disruption stranded 16.2 lakh domestic flyers: DGCA
content: The directorateâ€™s monthly traffic data for Dec 2025 says 16.2 lakh domestic flyers were stranded at airports across the country due to the non-availability of either IndiGo aircraft or their crew members. The number of people affected due to total cancellation of flights was 9.8 lakh, while those stranded at the airports due to delays beyond two hours were 6.4 lakh.

title: Ghaziabad sisters' suicide: 'They wanted to become Korean,' says father
content: Three sisters in Ghaziabad allegedly died by suicide, with preliminary findings suggesting heavy influence from Korean online content and games. Their father acknowledged financial stress but denied it as a cause, stating the girls lived in a fantasy world. Neighbors noted the sisters' isolation and lack of interaction, with their schooling being irregular and academic performance below average.

title: Savannah Guthrieâ€™s missing mother: Family pleads for answers in new video
content: An 84-year-old woman, Nancy Guthrie, mother of "Today" show host Savannah Guthrie, remains missing after her suspected abduction from her Tucson home. Investigators are treating ransom notes demanding millions in bitcoin as credible, with deadlines set for Thursday and Monday. The family has pleaded for direct contact to confirm her well-being.

title: ED files chargesheet in R.G. Kar Hospital financial irregularities case
content: Former principal of the medical college, Sandip Ghosh, is one of the accused in the case and is at present in judicial remand

title: Oil, gas block auction deadline extended for fourth time
content: While DGH did not give any reason for the extension, industry sources say this may have been done to give potential investors time to study the new liberalised rules framed

title: Merchant navy official from Odisha 'missing' from vessel near Mauritius
content: Sources in the Odisha Government said they have taken up the issue with the authorities concerned in New Delhi and requested them to inquire into the incident

title: Ramesh Chennithala says Transport Minister â€˜weakening KSRTC to benefitâ€™ private operators in Kerala
content: Chennithala says the Ministerâ€™s approach amounted to â€˜abandoning KSRTC to a slow deathâ€™ by failing to purchase new buses and not making necessary appointments

title: Parliament Budget Session: Rajya Sabha MP seeks 45-day leave for care of elderly parents
content: The MP highlighted the plight of the "sandwich generation" â€“ those caught between caring for aging parents and managing professional responsibilities

title: NITI Aayog CEO submits ASSET blueprint to Andhra Pradesh Chief Secretary
content: It was mentioned in the ASSET plan that 47% of Andhra Pradeshâ€™s total power generation capacity is contributed by renewable sourcesÂ

title: Total shutdown affects normal life in Manipur's Churachandpur district
content: Markets remained shut and vehicles off the roads. Educational and government offices also witnessed poor attendance

title: Assam Congress issues show-cause notice to joint secy Panjak Saikia for remarks against former State chief
content: The party's Assam unit general secretary (organisation) Bipul Gogoi, in the notice issued on Thursday (February 5, 2026), asked Mr. Saikia to furnish his response within 24 hours

title: Four minors taken hostage and assaulted in Gurugram; two attackers arrested
content: The arrested accused revealed that they took the children as hostages as they thought they would commit theft in an under-construction building

title: Omar Abdullah presents J&K Budget, emphasises on inclusive growth, fiscal prudence
content: The J&K Chief Minister said the financial plan aims to lay a strong foundation for sustainable growth, social harmony, and economic prosperity in the Union Territory

title: Kerala actor Maniyanpilla Raju arrested in hit-and-run case; let off on station bail
content: CCTV visuals show that the actorâ€™s car knocked down a motorcycle and proceeded without stopping to check on the condition of the injured. The incident occurred near Trivandrum Club in Thiruvananthapuram city late Thursday

title: Motorcyclist dies after falling into pit on under-construction road in west Delhi
content: This incident comes weeks after the death of 27-year-old software engineer Yuvraj Mehta, who drowned after his car fell into a waterlogged pit near a construction site in Noida Sector 150

title: Kerala CSR fund scam: FIR against four, including senior BJP leader A.N. Radhakrishnan
content: They have been charged with criminal breach of trust and cheating. The scam relates to alleged cheating of people by falsely promising scooters, laptops and sewing machines at half price using CSR funds

title: RSS starts Kashmir to Kanyakumari 'Dhwaj Yatra'
content: The yatra symbolically began from the historic Lal Chowk and culminated at the Tourist Reception Centre, where the participants boarded vehicles for onward journey to other parts of the country

title: CM Stalin to address DMKâ€™s south zone youth-wing meet in Virudhunagar on February 7
content: Speaking to reporters on Friday, DMK Virudhunagar North district secretary and State Finance Minister Thangam Thennarasu said that the meeting will be significant, as it comes ahead of the Assembly election

title: Political parties rejected by the people cannot use courts to gain popularity, Supreme Court tells Jan Suraaj Party
content: The court said that it is seriously viewing the culture of irrational freebies before elections, but casts doubt on the bona fide of the Jan Suraaj Party, which has just lost the Assembly polls

title: Oxygen tank flow meter cap bursts, injures female attendant at medical college hospital in Kerala
content: Attendant suffered head injury in the incident that occurred around 1 a.m. and no one else was injured, a hospital spokesperson said

title: T.N. CM Stalin unveils Karl Marxâ€™s statue at Chennaiâ€™s Egmore Museum
content: Mr. Stalin, on April 2 last year, announced that the State government would install a statue of the German philosopher in the city

title: Private sleeper bus catches fire on Bengaluru outskirts, all passengers and crew are safe
content: According to police sources, the bus crashed into an electric pole near Hanumanthapura around 12.15 a.m., following which all the passengers were evacuated

title: 'Good friend in Washington nearing century but PM silent': Congress as Trump repeats India-Pakistan claim
content: Jairam Rameshâ€™s remarks come after Mr. Trump repeated twice in a single day the claim that he stopped the war between India and Pakistan last year

title: Focus not only on marks but also on improving life: PM Modi to students
content: â€œCultivate the mind, then connect with your inner self, and then choose whatever subjects you want to study. Then you will always find the student to be successful,â€ PM Modi said to students

title: Central University of Karnataka signs MoU with Kalike-Tata Trust to strengthen early childhood education through village libraries
content: The MoU signing on February 5 was followed by a one-day training programme for gram panchayat librarians from Koppal and Yadgir districts

title: Bengaluru civic bodies plan off-street parking as on-street enforcement set to tighten
content: Police officers said that off-road parking, multi-level parking (MLP), and other parking facilities are no longer optional, but necessary, as available space will shrink significantly once on-street parking is strictly enforced

title: Actor Vijayâ€™s tax penalty case: Madras High Court dismisses his plea seeking relief
content: Justice Senthilkumar Ramamoorthy refuses to set aside the â‚¹1.5-crore penalty imposed on him for not having voluntarily disclosed an additional income of â‚¹15 crore in 2015-16

title: The holy trinity of cancer care: biochemistry, microbiology and pathology
content: Biochemistry, microbiology and pathology are the eyes that see the unseen world of cancer care, quietly doing the heavy lifting behind the scenes. In todayâ€™s world of precision medicine and personalised care, they play a critical role

title: 2025 boat accident in Bahraich: Process begins to resettle 136 families
content: The proposed colony will have proper drainage, concrete roads, green spaces, LED streetlights, drinking water facilities and other essential infrastructure

title: Farmers now getting loans in 5 minutes through e-KCC: Adityanath
content: The chief minister said the government and farmers are jointly exploring the use of artificial intelligence (AI) in agriculture.

title: Karnataka High Court notice to SEC on plea to notify schedule in 15 days for elections to Shivamogga City Corporation
content: The petitioner has pointed out that the SEC and the government of Karnataka have violated provisions of the Constitution of India in not holding timely elections to the council of SCC, the term of which ended on August 30, 2023

title: Meghalaya coal mine explosion: Two mine owners arrested, rescue operations ongoing
content: CM Conrad K. Sangma claimed the government has been cracking down on illegal rat-hole mines with over 1,000 cases registered and hundreds charge-sheeted

title: Bengaluru police want to tow your vehicle, but where is the place to park them?
content: A senior officer from the Northeast division told The Hindu that they now have no option but to park all seized vehicles within police station premises, creating a new challenge in managing space around the stations

title: Illicit poppy plantations on 200 acres destroyed in Manipur
content: â€œIllegal poppy plantations on 185 acres of land were destroyed in Khamashom and Leingangching hill ranges in Ukhrul district,â€ says police

title: NITK offers alternative to mobile network during emergency, links schools and colleges in coastal KarnatakaÂ through HAM radio network
content: The projectÂ combines disaster communication, technical education and community outreach using an amateur wireless communication system that does not rely on mobile phone networks or internet connectivity

title: Issues of displaced people top priority of new government: Manipur CM
content: â€œThe biggest issue is that internally displaced people are not able to return to their homes. The government will formulate a roadmap very soon,â€ Manipur CM Yumnam Khemchand Singh said

title: AAP leader Lucky Oberoi shot dead in Punjab, Opposition tears into government over poor law and order
content: The police said two scooter-borne unidentified assailants opened fire at Mr. Oberoi outside a Gurdwara in the Model Town area

title: Kerala actor Maniyanpillai Raju involved in hit-and-run incident; two youths on motorcycle injured

content: The programme supports divyang women through financial assistance, a statement issued by the Adani Group stated

title: Healthcare industry needs to functionally readjust to meet challenges posed by climate change: Experts

title: Tiger tale: Life in the territory of fear in Andhra Pradesh
content: The ongoing human-animal conflict in Andhra Pradesh, where a sub-adult male tiger killed 20 heads of cattle in East Godavari and Eluru districts, has upended the livelihoods of many tobacco growers, dairy farmers and agricultural workers. Nellore Sravani writes about the panic prevailing among the people and the Forest departmentâ€™s race to find out why an apparently healthy tiger is killing livestock in human habitats

title: Global navies to gather in Visakhapatnam for International Fleet Review and MILAN 2026
content: Visakhapatnam will host a slate of major maritime events in February, bringing global navies to Indiaâ€™s east coast

content: While slamming the NDA government in Bihar under Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, Tejashwi Yadav charged that it was running on â€œfalse praise and complete negligenceâ€

title: Transplanted lives: Organ donation in Kerala gains traction
content: Organ donation from live donors and harvested from brain-dead patients is often mired in controversies and misconceptions. Aathira Haridas meets some of the organ recipients and donors to understand the complex emotional and medical aspects of the life-saving process, which is slowly gaining ground in the State

title: The Lighthouse Bar opens at The Park Visakhapatnam
content: The Lighthouse Bar at The Park returns to a familiar address in the city with quiet confidence and sharp flavours

title: Migrant hands rooted across Telanganaâ€™s farms
content: From grape farms on Hyderabadâ€™s fringes to paddy fields deep in the countryside, Telanganaâ€™s agriculture is being sustained by workers from other States. Farmers, activists and government officials say the migrants have become indispensable to farm operations here even as local youth step away from fieldwork. K. Shiva ShankerÂ traces the forces reshaping farm labour in the State

title: Classic case of consensual relationship turning acrimonious: Supreme Court quashes FIR alleging rape
content: The bench delivered its verdict on an appeal challenging a March last year order of the Chhattisgarh High Court that had refused to quash the proceedings arising out of the FIR registered in Bilaspur district in February 2025

title: Shrinking shock absorbers of Bannerghatta National Park in Bengaluru
content: Instead of maintaining the ESZ whose main objective is to function as a buffer for protected areas, successive governments have worked at reducing the ESZ around the Bannerghatta National Park in south Bengaluru. Hemanth C.S. looks at the implications

title: Loud music may damage your hearing before you realise it
content: Research has shown that prolonged exposure to loud noise can damage synapses without affecting the hearing threshold; since clinical assessments bank on this threshold, a normal audiogram need not mean no hearing damage

title: Death by cyberchondria

title: How the two-language policy impacted the teachers of other languages in 1968
content: On January 23, 1968, the firstÂ DMKÂ government, headed byÂ C.N.Â Annadurai, adopted a resolution in the Madras Assembly scrapping the three-language formulaÂ and mandating the teaching of only Tamil and English. The immediate switchover affected over 4,000 Hindi and Sanskrit teachers at about 2,400 schools in the State

title: Documents on anti-Hindi agitation wiped out onÂ Bhaktavatsalamâ€™sÂ order
content: On February 24, 1967, a month before losing power to theÂ DMK, the last Congress Chief Minister ordered the Public Department to destroy recordsÂ on the anti-Hindi agitation that rocked the State. content: Clearly defined timelines for audits; Audit is to be done on financial year basis in place of calendar year; and Broadcasters can depute their representative during audit to ensure transparency and credibility of the audit process, among the main features of the regulations

title: FIR over scuffle in BHU campus as UGC issue take centre stage
